title: Contribution guide is out of date
body:
### Describe the problem

#### Sandbox Example
From the [contribution](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) guide:

> You can now run SvelteKit by linking it into your project with [pnpm overrides](https://pnpm.io/package_json#pnpmoverrides) as demonstrated in the [sandbox example](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit-sandbox) or by running one of the test projects as described in [the testing section](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#testing) below.

The second link to the sandbox project has pnpm commands that run the [`kit/packages/kit/src/cli.js`](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/master/packages/kit/src/cli.js) script, passing it commands such as `dev` and `build`. This script only defines one CLI arg, `sync`, so it's impossible to actually run the sandbox project.

#### Building

Also from the contribution guide:

> You must rebuild each time before running the tests if you've made code changes.

Maybe I'm missing something but it's seems unclear how to build the project, as there's is no pnpm build command of any sort. Is the project supposed to be built to a `.dist` folder?

### Describe the proposed solution

- Update the [sandbox example](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit-sandbox) so it works. 
- Provide a command for building the project so tests can run on changed code.

### Alternatives considered

_No response_

### Importance

would make my life easier

### Additional Information

There are some bugs in Sveltekit I'm trying to fix since they relate to my specific project.
